intro: Malvastrum englerianum, commonly known as the Engler's mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are hairy and upright. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
